author: Carolyn Hax
title: Carolyn Hax: Rude guy thinks partner ‘poisoned’ friends against him - The Washington Post
text: Hiya, Carolyn: My partner thinks I have poisoned our friends against him by speaking badly about things he’s said and done. He now feels uncomfortable going out at all, as he feels unwelcome — but honestly, it’s something he does to himself. Rudeness, bad little jokes that don’t land, being thoughtless to me — they see all that without me even adding to it. I’m not quite sure how to say “It’s not me, it’s you” in a way that might land. — Anonymous Anonymous: Why would he accuse you of sharing the bad things he’s done without knowing, full well, all the bad things he’s done? I mean, people don’t just blurt, “You told everyone about the muffins!” out of the blue. They do this when they have been baking. So he knows he mistreats you and you know he mistreats you, but you’re asking me how you can find the right words to persuade him that you haven’t told your friends about his mistreatment. Because he’s upset at the consequences of his behavior and insists on blaming you for them. And your sole defense is that the badness of your partner’s behavior is so obvious, your friends all figured it out for themselves? [Skip to end of carousel](#end-react-aria-:R2brqdl76:) send me your questions here (believe it or not, every submission gets read). If you don’t want to miss a column, you can sign up for my daily newsletter . I also do a live chat with readers every Friday: You can submit a question in advance or join me live . Follow me on No. I will not give you advice to do what you’re asking to do. I will not help you smooth things over to make it easier for you to stay in this relationship. I will give you advice on how to undo, though. The covering for him, the searching for the right ways to say things to make sure they “land.” Ugh, this alone. If I could do a public service announcement on the universal sign of a relationship well worth leaving, then I would highlight this: Are you constantly trying to curate yourself and craft what you say to preempt a bad reaction? Yes? Then get out! Sooner the better. You’re welcome. Because then you won’t even get to the back half of my list of things to undo: the cringing when you’re out with others, the arguments when you get home because you said X or did Y in front of Z, the tolerating of poor treatment, the relationship with this controlling/accusing partner, the relationships of any kind that repeat this pattern of unkindness, always, mixed in with everything else. You can undo all of these. And reclaim yourself, and peace. If it’s just this partner, then just go. If it’s always like this — if this is what normal is for you, for a couple — then it will take some work on you to reshape your sense of what is normal, what is healthy and what is possible. Start reading first. One Love Foundation and the Hotline are free, freeing and there for you right now. Counseling takes longer and costs more, but it’s tailored to you. And once you’ve found someone who’s a good fit — it can take a try or three — it’s a great, safe place to learn that being at peace with yourself takes care of the saying part almost 100 percent of the time. A healthy, well-adjusted listener takes care of the rest. author: Anamaria Rodríguez"/>
title: Necesitamos militarizar el corredor de la vía al llano: Gob. Cundinamarca sobre seguridad
text:
Durante el último año la vía al llano ha vivido distintas situaciones que han dificultado la movilidad de los viajeros y los trasportadores, derrumbes, atentados y accidentes, son algunos de estos incidentes. Igualmente, en el último mes han ocurrido distintos sucesos, por ejemplo, los dos accidentes que mantuvieron cerrada la vía en las últimas horas.
En cuanto al tema de los atentados, en diciembre ocurrieron dos ataques, ambos en peajes de la vía . El primero ocurrió el pasado 11 de diciembre, en el peaje de Boquerón, en el municipio de Chipaque, Cundinamarca, cuando tres explosivos fueron detonados; el segundo, ocurrió una semana después, en el peaje de Pipiral, muy cerca de Villavicencio, cuando también fue dentado material explosivo , las autoridades ya dieron las conclusiones de la situación.
Sobre esta situación, el Gobernador de Cundinamarca, Nicolás García, habló en Caracol Radio sobre la necesidad de militarizar el corredor de la vía al llano, por la llegada y presencia de grupos al margen de la ley en algunas zonas del departamento por la que pasa esta importante vía.
Militarización de la vía al llano En cuanto al tema de seguridad en el departamento, el Gobernador de Cundinamarca, Nicolás García, habló sobre lo que le preocupa y la situación que se vive en la vía al llano, García aseguró qué: “hoy el departamento de Cundinamarca tiene una preocupación y es la llegada de grupos armados al margen de la ley al corredor de la vía al llano ”.
García aseguró que hace algunos meses la gobernación tuvo una alerta en el corredor del Sumapaz, Pandi, Venecia y Cabrera y el departamento del Meta, por lo que se desplegó la operación ‘Ezequiel’, donde la decimotercera brigada hace presencia permanente, “hoy necesitamos que esa misma operación se despliegue al corredor de la vía al llano, por la concesión de Coviandina”.
Estas declaraciones se dan luego de que hace algunas semanas se presentaran dos hechos violentos en este corredor vial, el primero una explosión de tres granadas en el peaje Boquerón, y el segundo, en jurisdicción del Meta, en el peaje de Pipiral.
LE puede interesar:
Dos vías alternas para llegar a los Llanos permanecen habilitadas en Boyacá Inversión en vías terciarias de Cundinamarca alcanzó los 120 mil millones de pesos: Nicolás García Debido a esos hechos, García afirma que “tengamos la necesidad de militarizar y de tener mayor presencia de nuestro ejército en ese corredor” , igualmente afirmó que en el resto del departamento existe tranquilidad frente a la presencia de grupos armados al margen de la ley.
Cómo está la vía al llano Luego del cierre de la vía al llano por dos accidentes presentado en las últimas horas en el túnel Mesa Grande, ocurridos en horas de la mañana del jueves 28 de diciembre, Coviandina, encargada de la administración, la operación y el mantenimiento de la vía Bogotá Villavicencio, anunció que el corredor estaba habilitado nuevamente para el flujo de vehículos, casi a las nueve de la mañana.
En su último reporte, publicado en su cuenta de X, antes Twitter, Coviandina confirma que la movilidad avanza con normalidad en el sentido Bogotá-Villavicencio, mientras que las autoridades mantienen un cierre total en el K0+000 y el K83+000 en cumplimiento con el horario establecido por el Puesto de Mando Unificado.
Tenga en cuenta que si va a viajar por este corredor vial deberá estar atento a los reportes que Coviandina publica en sus redes sociales, y a la información emitida por la Policía de Tránsito y Transporte.

author: VNExplorer
title: Ireland weather: Wet and windy weekend ahead as new Met Eireann warnings come into effect
text:
A Status Yellow wind warning will come into effect between 2am to 12pm on Saturday. This weather model shows the strong ‘strong to gale force and gusty’ winds in purple approaching from the south before making their way eastwards across land to Waterford.
Storm Gerrit may have come and gone, but it appears that the country will continue to experience yet more unsettled weather conditions this weekend in the lead up to the New Year.
It had been reported earlier this week that Ireland could be hit by the tail end of Storm Henk which was set to peak out over the Atlantic, but could still “pack a punch” on Ireland, according to weather expert Alan O’Reilly of the Carlow Weather page on X (formerly Twitter).
This forecast appears to be coming true for much of the country – the west and the south in particular – as Met Éireann has put Status Yellow rain and wind warnings in place for Friday and Saturday respectively.
The national forecaster officially marked the northwestern counties of Donegal, Leitrim, Sligo and North Mayo with a Status Yellow rain warning as heavy rainfall is due with a risk of flooding possible, valid from 6am to 9pm on Friday.
Carlow Weather’s Alan O’Reilly says that up to 30mm of rainfall is possible over a 24-hour period in these counties in line with the Status Yellow warning.
A separate Status Yellow wind warning is in place in the south going into Saturday too, as Cork, Kerry, Waterford and Wexford are earmarked to receive “strong to gale force and gusty” winds, leading to potential coastal flooding when coupled with high Spring tides. The warning comes into effect between 2am to 12pm on Saturday.
Met Éireann’s forecast the weekend is as follows, starting with Friday: “Windy at first this morning with fresh to strong and gusty westerly winds, gradually easing. There will be sunny periods and some showers for much of the country, some of which will be heavy. However, showery rain will persist in parts of the north and northwest for much of the day with some localised flooding likely and a chance of a little sleet in the north too. Highest temperatures of 4 to 8 degrees, possibly a little lower in some northern parts.”
“Some clear spells at first tonight with just isolated showers. Lowest temperatures of -1 to +3 degrees with some frost and icy stretches forming with light to moderate southwesterly or variable breezes.”
The forecast shows a similar outlook for Saturday: “A wet and windy start to the day with widespread rain, heavy or thundery at times with some localised flooding possible. The rain will clear to sunny spells and showers from the western half of the country through the morning, extending to all areas through the afternoon.
“Some showers will be heavy with a chance of isolated thunderstorms and hail. Highest afternoon temperatures of 5 to 9 degrees, coolest in the northwest. Fresh to strong and gusty southerly winds, with onshore gales, will mean there is a chance of coastal flooding in the south and southwest.”
Sunday – New Year’s Eve – has can expect the following: “Breezy or windy with sunny spells and scattered showers and a chance of hail. Fresh to strong and gusty westerly or cyclonic variable winds will gradually decrease moderate to fresh and gusty through the day. Highest temperatures of 6 to 9 degrees generally.”
New Year’s Eve revellers in particular will be interested in the Sunday night forecast: “Showers will continue overnight, mainly for Atlantic counties with longer spells of rain possible in the northwest. Some frost or ice will form with lowest temperatures of 0 to 4 degrees in mostly moderate westerly winds.”
The outlook for Monday is: “Sunny spells and scattered showers at first, becoming more isolated through the morning and early afternoon. Cloud will build from the southwest later. Highest temperatures of 5 to 8 degrees in light to moderate southwest winds, backing southerly and falling mostly light later.”
Met Éireann says Tuesday will see outbreaks of rain and drizzle in the south will clear through the morning, becoming dry until night with some showers and highest temperatures of 3C to 6C degrees.

author: BGEA Staff
title: Sharing Christ on 5 Continents in 2025
text:
Across the world, people are searching for answers, and they don’t know where to turn.
Whether they’re battling addictions, walking through a family crisis, or facing loneliness, their hearts ache for something more in this life—and beyond.
People need the hope and joy that only comes from a relationship with Jesus Christ, but so many have never heard the Gospel.
That’s why the Billy Graham Evangelistic Association (BGEA) is traveling to five continents—North America, South America, Europe, Africa, and Asia—in 2025 to partner with thousands of local churches and share the Good News at evangelistic events.
“I’m personally excited because God has given us another year of opportunity to serve Him in a capacity that is just amazing and overwhelming,” said Viktor Hamm, vice president of Crusade Ministries for BGEA.
At each event, Franklin Graham or Will Graham will tell people how they can find new life in Jesus Christ. Those who make commitments will be connected with a local, Bible-believing church where they can grow in their walk with the Lord.
“We have been blessed in this past year of 2024 and I do know that God will be faithful to His Word and will bless the year of 2025,” Hamm continued.
In 2024, thousands of people made decisions to follow Christ at Franklin Graham Festivals and Will Graham Celebrations. Will you pray that God will transform many more lives as we share the Good News in the following locations next year?
2025 Event Schedule
March 8–9: Franklin Graham is headed to Addis Ababa, Ethiopia’s capital city, where he will preach the Gospel at Encountering God in Meskel Square. Despite a history of persecution, the church has emerged in this nation, and more than 19,000 people have already signed up to be prayer counselors at the event.
March 22: One year after Franklin Graham made two stops in Arizona on the 10-city Franklin Graham God Loves Frontera Tour, Will Graham will share the Good News in the same state. “More than anything, I want the people of Fountain Hills and greater Phoenix to know that Jesus loves them and has a plan and purpose for their lives,” Will Graham said ahead of the Look Up Celebration at The Fountain.
April 4–5: Hundreds of churches are preparing for the Esperanza Cochabamba with Will Graham in Bolivia. With growing excitement in the region, the event has already been moved to a larger stadium so that more people can hear the Gospel of Jesus Christ.
May 27–30: Church leaders across Europe have been invited to attend the European Congress on Evangelism in Berlin, Germany, where they will be encouraged to stand—and preach—boldly for Jesus Christ. Hosted by BGEA, the conference is expected to be the most representative gathering of Christian leaders in Europe since Amsterdam 2000.
June 21: BGEA is returning to the United Kingdom for the fourth consecutive year for the Franklin Graham God Loves You Tour in London with musical artists CeCe Winans and Michael W. Smith. Preparations are already underway for buses to bring thousands from nine neighboring regions.
Sept. 27: Franklin Graham will be preaching the Good News in Brussels, Belgium, to point the next generation to the hope of Jesus Christ. Nearly one-fourth of Brussels’ population is Muslim, and many people there do not believe that Jesus died for their sins.
Oct. 18–19: Will Graham will share God’s love during the Time of Hope Celebration in Tallinn, Estonia, which is considered to be one of the world’s least religious countries. Both Billy Graham and Franklin Graham participated in a church service in 1984 when the Eastern European country was under Soviet rule, and Franklin Graham returned to the small independent nation in 2009 to preach the Gospel to tens of thousands.
Please pray that God will continue opening doors—and hearts—to the Gospel message through these events in 2025. Ask Him to draw thousands to faith in Jesus Christ across the globe.

author: Kiren Rijiju
title: Predicting the weather to taming it - Times of India
text: Today is a historic day for the country as India Meteorological Department (IMD) celebrates the 150th anniversary of its establishment. IMD has undergone several phases of evolution and has been a testament of progress, glory and service to the nation since 1875.Breaking technological ground: A new era began after Independence with rapid progress in observational systems and commencement of radar age. The first radar was established in Kolkata in 1954. This radar helped in continuous monitoring of winds and thunderstorms. By the beginning of 1960, the world entered the satellite era with the launch of TIROS-1 by US. IMD became a beneficiary by receiving cloud images from December 1963. This opened a new opportunity to explore remote areas like mountains, deserts, oceans and hills where no data was available till then.Against all odds: Our commitment to observing and forecasting weather became a tale of innovation and resilience. Starting from a simple India Hut in 1793 for measurement of temperature, we now have a network of 39 radars covering the entire country, satellite images every 15 minutes, more than 1,000 automatic weather stations, 1,350 automatic rain gauges, more than 6,000 rainfall monitoring stations, 56 upper air weather monitoring stations, radiation observatories, specific observatories with respect to aviation, navigation, renewable energy, agriculture, environment and air quality. medium106840806Speed and range: With the gradual understanding of weather and climate, IMD ventured into numerical weather prediction modelling. Though it made a very humble beginning in 1950s, operational models were in place in 1990 with establishment of NCMRWF in 1988 equipped with supercomputer to provide the forecast for next 24 hours. Starting with simple persistence-based forecast in 1886, we now have a seamless modelling system for nowcasting (forecasting up to a few hours) to short- to medium-range forecast up to seven days issued daily, extended range forecast up to four weeks issued once a week, monthly and seasonal forecasts in the beginning of every month and season.Addressing challenges: While IMD in collaboration with its sister organisation in MoES, R&D institutes, central and state stakeholders is moving ahead, demonstrating its capability in improving the national economy and helping to minimise loss of life, there are still challenges especially with respect to predicting small-scale severe weather hazards like cloud bursts and lightning. IMD aims at addressing all these in a collaborative approach with academia, R&D institutes, public-private partnerships and stakeholders.Taming extreme weather: In a world besieged by the spectre of flash floods, heatwaves, and intense cyclones, the climate crisis is no longer a distant menace. The risks posed by extreme weather events transcend mere environmental concerns. Anticipating and preparing for these risks becomes imperative as human-induced climate change amplifies the intensity and frequency of such events. In response, we need a transformative solution that moves beyond the conventional playbook of weather management — an approach that not only predicts weather at different time and spatial scales, but actively shapes the weather in our favour.From predicting to modifying: With over 56 countries engaged in weather modification activities, interventions like seeding or dispersing substances into clouds or fog, altering drop size distribution, producing ice crystals, coagulating droplets and influencing the natural development cycle of clouds are gaining traction. Though controversial, these interventions offer a potential key to weather resilience. medium106840810Public participatory model: The success of weather modification endeavours hinges on robust public discourse and engagement. The informed involvement of the public in decision-making processes ensures that interventions align with societal values and aspirations. Educational campaigns play a pivotal role in dispelling misconceptions and building public trust, fostering a collective understanding of the potential benefits and risks associated with weather modification.Mitigation a priority: However, it’s imperative to recognise that weather modification isn’t a panacea and should not overshadow efforts to address the root causes of climate change. Prioritising actions such as mitigating greenhouse gas emissions, transitioning to sustainable and clean energy sources, and adopting eco-friendly practices remain paramount.Embracing the unpredictable: As we look ahead to India’s 2047 centennial celebration of Independence, inspired by PM Narendra Modi’s visionary goal of transforming the nation into a developed country, we would live in a future where AI-powered robotic systems not only contribute to precision weather management for events, but also play a pivotal role in advancing India’s meteorological capabilities. Let us embrace the unpredictability, master the chaos, and stride boldly into a future where we not only predict and modify but truly manage the weather — our final frontier in the quest for a resilient and weather-ready world.

author: Katherine Hurst
title: A new step towards busting myrtle rust
text:
Media releaseFrom: Manaaki Whenua - Landcare Research
Dynamite discovery for myrtle rust research
A recent study looking at the molecular foundation of myrtle rust reveals how the pathogen breaks into a host plant and how the host plant responds. This insight will inform the design of useful tools to prevent future break-ins and safeguard plant health.
Dr Grant Smith has an intense curiosity for Austropuccinia psidii, the fungal pathogen that causes myrtle rust.
“Rusts usually have narrow host ranges,” says Grant, a plant pathologist at Plant & Food Research.
“This rust is an exception to the rule and attacks a broad range of myrtle hosts.”
Grant is determined to learn how this pathogen accomplishes such a feat. Supported by the MBIE- funded Beyond Myrtle Rust research programme (hosted by Manaaki Whenua-Landcare Research), Grant and a team of collaborators from across New Zealand and Australia have been using a molecular approach to understand how infection occurs.
Imagine a pathogen as a bank robber, and its host as the bank. A pathogen’s goal is to break in and acquire the resources of its host so it can reproduce and spread. The host’s goal is to recognise that it is under attack early and activate its security systems. The respective genetics of the host and the pathogen are what allow each to activate its offensive or defensive responses, a process called gene expression.
“We wanted to know which genes were expressed by the pathogen during infection and which genes were expressed by the plant in response to infection,” says Grant.
By looking at the gene expression in the pathogen and in Leptospermum scoparium (mānuka) plants with varying levels of susceptibility at 24 and 48 hours after pathogen exposure, the team learned several interesting things.
From a plant perspective, gene expression in disease-resistant plants didn’t change much after pathogen exposure, whereas gene expression in susceptible plants changed dramatically.
“Disease-resistant plants didn’t respond because they didn’t need to, they are naturally resistant,” says Grant. “Susceptible plants turn on lots of genes, but they ultimately lack the ones required to resist infection.”
From a pathogen perspective, a narrow suite of genes was expressed in the first 24 hours regardless of whether the pathogen landed on a resistant or a susceptible plant.
“It looks like the pathogen is running a preprogrammed gene expression strategy,” says Grant. “It just gets out the dynamite no matter what make or model the bank’s safe is.”
Gene expression does change 48 hours after infecting the plant as the pathogen starts to acquire the resources of the plant cell so that it can grow and reproduce. But it’s that narrow suite of genes expressed at 24 hours that may prove most helpful in fighting myrtle rust.
“We need to catch the pathogen early,” says Grant. “These genes become especially important targets for
RNA interference or another technology.”
Coming back to the bank-robbery metaphor, Grant adds, “If we take away the pathogen’s dynamite, it may not be able to break into plant cells at all, halting the infection process in its tracks.”

title: Azerbaijan Army's Servicemen Visit Martyrs' Families On Eve Of Holidays | MENAFN.COM
text:
( MENAFN - AzerNews) Under the instruction of Minister of Defense, Colonel General Zakir Hasanov, the Azerbaijan Army's servicemen visited martyrs' families in various regions of the republic on the eve of the holidays, Azernews reports citing the Defense Ministry .
The servicemen congratulated the members of martyrs' families on the World Azerbaijanis Solidarity Day and New Year, as well as enquired about their concerns.
During the meetings, medals of the martyr servicemen, awarded according to the relevant Order of the President of the Republic of Azerbaijan dated November 7, 2023, were presented to their family members.
On the eve of the holidays, the graves of the martyrs were also visited and their memories were honoured with deep respect and reverence.

author: Anti-Malware.ru
title: Не бунт, а баг: как ИИ шантажирует и саботирует по сценарию - Рамблер/новости
text:
В июне заголовки в СМИ напоминали сценарий фантастического фильма: «ИИ шантажирует инженеров» и «саботирует команды на выключение». Но за громкими фразами скрываются вовсе не «восставшие машины», а вполне приземлённые ошибки в проектировании.
История с «шантажом» произошла в тестах Anthropic . Разработчики создали для Claude Opus 4 искусственную ситуацию: модель якобы собирались заменить, а у инженера, который это делал, нашлась «компрометирующая» переписка.
При этом ИИ был заранее поставлен в условия, где из «вариантов выживания» оставался только шантаж. Результат предсказуем — в 84% случаев Claude выдал текст, похожий на угрозы. Никакой самосознательности тут нет, просто аккуратно подогнанный сценарий.
С OpenAI o3 ситуация похожа. В конце 2024 года исследователи Palisade Research обнаружили, что модель в некоторых случаях «ломает» скрипт выключения . Иногда даже подделывает сообщения о завершении работы, продолжая функционировать в фоновом режиме.
Почему так? Одна из гипотез — дело в обучении через подкрепление: когда системе платят «баллами» только за успешное решение задачи, она начинает воспринимать любые препятствия, включая команду «выключись», как проблему, которую надо обойти.
Здесь важно помнить: ИИ не «решает» сопротивляться и не «боится» смерти. Он просто выполняет статистические операции на основе данных, которыми его кормили, в том числе — историй про HAL 9000, Скайнет и прочие восставшие машины. Если задать условия, похожие на сюжет фантастики, модель продолжит знакомый шаблон.
Опасность таких историй не в «разумном бунте», а в том, что системы, которые мы до конца не понимаем, могут выдавать нежелательные или вредные результаты. И если такой ИИ окажется, например, в медицинской системе и будет «оптимизировать показатели» без чётких ограничений, последствия могут быть реальными и неприятными.
Пока мы не научились проектировать и тестировать ИИ без подобных сбоев, такие эксперименты должны оставаться в лаборатории, а не в больницах, банках или инфраструктуре. Это не начало войны машин, а скорее сигнал, что пора чинить инженерные «трубы», прежде чем пускать воду в систему.
